para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: CLOGGING OF FILTER FOR THROUGH SPINDLE COOLANT WAS DETECTED. (LS190 IS ON).
Remove abnormality and check LS190 must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: NOZZLE COOLANT FLOW SWITCH (LS181) DOES NOT TURN OFF IN SPECIFIED TIME THOUGH COOLANT HAS STOPPED.
Nozzle coolant flow switch does not turn off within specified time.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: NOZZLE COOLANT FLOW SWITCH (LS181) HAS DETECTED LOW FLOW.
Nozzle coolant flow switch has low flow.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: LEVEL OF CLEAN COOLANT TANK IS LOW. (LS196 IS OFF).

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Clean coolant tank (Secondary tank) is low.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: With coolant not low LS196 must be '1'.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: ROTARY JOINT FOR THROUGH SPINDLE COOLANT HAS WORN OUT. (LS1340 IS OFF).
The rotary joint of the Through Spindle Coolant wears out. LS1340 is being off longer than 3 seconds.
Wear detection of rotary joint healthy condition LS1340 must be '1'

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: LEVEL OF PRIMARY COOLANT TANK IS LOW. (LS1319 IS OFF).
Primary coolant tank level is low.
With coolant level not low LS1319 must be '1'

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Coolant ON was commanded with door open.
Standard machine front door close status:
Auto single door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=ON; LS2312=OFF;
Auto double door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=OFF; LS912=ON;
APC machine operator door close status:

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: THROUGH SPINDLE COOLANT FLOW SWITCH (LS195) DOES NOT TURN OFF IN SPECIFIED TIME THOUGH COOLANT HAS STOPPED.
Flow switch of the Through Spindle Coolant does not turn OFF longer than 10 seconds though the pump has stopped. LS193 does not turn OFF.
Flow switch signal LS195 must be '0' when TSC is OFF.
Check malfunction of flow switch LS195.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: TSC motor thermal TH19 must be '0' when not overloaded.
Remove the abnormality and reset the thermal switch.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:4px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: THROUGH SPINDLE COOLANT FLOW SWITCH (LS195) HAS DETECTED LOW FLOW.
Flow of the Through Spindle Coolant has dropped. LS195 has turned OFF longer than the time specified though the pump is operating.
Flow switch signal LS195 must be '1' when TSC is ON.
Check piping and pump if coolant does not come out. Check malfunction of flow switch LS195 if coolant comes out.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: LEVEL OF PRIMARY COOLANT TANK IS HIGH (LS186 IS OFF)
With coolant level not high LS186 must be '1'

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: LEVEL OF SECONDARY COOLANT TANK IS HIGH (LS197 IS OFF).
With coolant level not high LS197 must be '1'

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: COOLANT TEMPERATURE CONTROLLER UNIT ALARM (CCHAL IS OFF).
When not alarm CCHAL must be '1'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: OIL TANK OF SPINDLE COOLER UNIT IS LOW LEVEL (LS176 IS OFF).
Oil tank of spindle cooler is low.
Remedy: Check oil tank level of spindle cooler unit.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: SPINDLE LUBRICATION OIL TEMPERATURE CONTROL IS ABNORMAL.
Spindle lubrication oil temperature controller is abnormal.
When not abnormal OMTAL must be '1'.
Check spindle lubrication oil temperature controller.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AIR DRIER UNIT ALARM OR CP21 IS TRIPPED. (AIRAL IS ON).
When not alarm AIRAL must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: LOW PRESSURE OF SUPPLIED AIR HAS CONTINUED MORE THAN SPECIFIED TIME.(LS905 IS OFF)
Main air pressure supply is low.
When not low pressure LS905 must be '1'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: EITHER OF CIRCUIT BREAKER CB2A/CB2B/CB2C HAS TRIPPED. CHECK POWER CIRCUIT.
When not tripped CB2 must be '1'.
Check power circuit. Check the reason for tripping and rectify.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: EITHER OF CIRCUIT BREAKER CP4/CP41/CP5/CP51/CP52/CP53 HAS TRIPPED.CHECK CONTROL CIRCUIT.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Thermal relay or fuse has tripped.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: When not tripped CPTP must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Check control circuit. Check the reason for tripping, rectify and turn ON the circuit protector.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:4px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: SPINDLE LUBRICATION OIL FLOW SWITCH DOES NOT TURN ON THOUGH PUMP IS RUNNING. (LS170 SIGNAL IS OFF).
Spindle lub oil flow switch not ON though pump is running.
When pump is running LS170 must be '1'
Check spindle lub oil flow and switch.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: SPINDLE LUBRICATION OIL FLOW SWITCH DOES NOT TURN OFF THOUGH PUMP IS STOPPING. (LS170 SIGNAL IS ON).
Spindle lub oil flow switch not OFF though pump is stopped.
When pump is stopped LS170 must be '0'
Check spindle lub oil flow and switch.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MAIN COOLANT PUMP MOTOR THERMAL RELAY HAS TRIPPED. (TH2=1).
Main coolant pump motor thermal is tripped.
When not tripped TH2 must be '0'.
Remove the abnormality and reset TH2.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AUTOMATIC GREASE SUPPLY PUMP PRESSURE DOESN'T GO UP.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Auto grease pressure does not go UP.
When pump is ON LS1698 must be '1'. Pump can be turned ON by M779 for checking purpose.
Check the pump unit and switch.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AUTOMATIC GREASE SUPPLY PUMP PRESSURE DOESN'T FALL.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Auto grease pressure does not go fall.
When pump is OFF LS1698 must be '0'. Pump can be turned ON by M779 for checking purpose.
Check the pump unit and switch.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: HYDRAULIC UNIT PRESSURE FAIL. LS969 DID NOT TURN ON WITHIN SPECIFIED TIME OF MS4 ON CHECK HYDRAULIC PIPING AND LS969 SETTING.
Tool clamp/unclamp pump MS4 is ON but pressure not build up.
When pump MS4 is ON LS969 must be '1'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: HYDRAULIC POWER PACK MOTOR THERMAL RELAY HAS TRIPPED. (TH4=1).
Hydraulic power pack thermal relay has tripped.
When thermal not tripped TH4 must be '0'.
Remove the abnormality and reset TH4.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: TRANSFER COOLANT PUMP MOTOR THERMAL RELAY HAS TRIPPED. (TH71=1).
Transfer coolant pump motor thermal has tripped.
When thermal not tripped TH71 must be '0'.
Remove the abnormality and reset TH71.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: POWER SAVE MODE ON. PRESS ALARM RESET TO RELEASE.
Press [ALARM RESET] button to release power saving mode.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MIST COLLECTOR ALARM, THERMAL TRIP OR UNIT ALARM.
When thermal not tripped TH300 must be '0'.
Remove the abnormality and reset TH300

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:4px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MAINTENANCE ALERT - X Y Z AXIS REQUIRES GREASING. SET K26.0 = 1 TO RESET ALARM.
Routine greasing is very important. Never skip this process. Else it will damage the machine.
Perform greasing and after greasing complete reset alarm by setting K26.0=1 and press [ALARM RESET] button.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MAINTENANCE ALERT - SPINDLE COLLET REQUIRES GREASING. SET K26.0 = 1 TO RESET ALARM.
Routine greasing is very important. Never skip this process. Else it will damage the machine.
Perform greasing and after greasing complete reset alarm by setting K26.0=1 and press [ALARM RESET] button.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Broken tool detected during broken tool check process.
If broken tool detected LS2111 will be '0'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Tool length for BT check tool entered in Tool Data Screen is not within valid range.
Enter valid tool length range between 75.000mm to 250.000mm.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Tool length for BT check tool entered in Tool Data Screen is not set (zero).
Enter valid tool length range between 75.000mm to 250.000mm.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: BTS LIMIT SWITCH IS STICKY OR BROKEN. (SKIP=0)
BTS limit switch is sticky or broken.
Check the condition or actuation condition of BTS limit switch. When the sensor is not actuated SKIP status must be 1.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: BROKEN TOOL SENSOR OPTION IS NOT PROVIDED, SO M433 CAN NOT BE PERFORMED.CHECK PMC PARAMETER:K20.6.
BTS option not selected. But BTS M-Code is commanded. Hence alarm.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: WORK COUNTER COUNT-UP/RESET ALARM. S-CODE MUST BE FROM 1 TO 8.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: The S-Code used with the command to increment or reset the work counter, M438/M439 is not within the proper counter number range.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Specify a counter number within the proper range. From S1 to S8 will be accepted.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AUTOMATIC WORKPIECE MEASURING ALARM: BATTERY ALARM.
The battery voltage for the automatic workpiece-measuring probe is low. Battery alarm (MSALB) of the automatic workpiece-measuring has been turned ON.
Probe battery healthy then MSALB must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AUTOMATIC WORKPIECE MEASURING ALARM: BATTERY ALARM.
The battery voltage for the automatic workpiece-measuring probe is low. Battery alarm (MSALB) of the automatic workpiece-measuring has been turned ON.
Probe battery healthy then MSALB must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

table.style: width:auto; cell-padding:4px; cell-spacing:0px; page-break-inside:auto; border-width:0px; border-spacing:0px; border-collapse:collapse; cell-border-width:1px; border-color:#000000; border-style:solid; background-color:none; head-row-background-color:none; alt-row-background-color:none;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: AUTOMATIC WORKPIECE MEASURING ALARM: POWER STILL ON AFTER M911.
The probe power is not OFF after the M911 (measuring head alarm check) command is sent. Reception alarm (*MSALA) of the automatic workpiece measuring is turned ON.
When probe is OFF *MSALA must be '0'
This may indicate a malfunction of the measuring probe. Check probe and related circuit.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: EMERGENCY STOP ALARM OCCURRED DURING MEASURING MODE.
An emergency stop was triggered during the M86 (automatic measuring rapid feed) mode. The measuring probe may have come into contact with an object during non measurement mode.
Carefully move the feed axis to retract the probe.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MEASURING PROBE POWER OFF DID NOT OCCUR IN THE SPECIFIED TIME.
The probe power does not go OFF within the specified time (2sec) when the M963 (Turn OFF measuring probe power & confirm) command is sent.
This may indicate a malfunction of the measuring probe. Check probe and related circuit.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MEASURING PROBE POWER ON DID NOT OCCUR IN THE SPECIFIED TIME.
The probe power does not go ON within the specified time(2sec) when the M964 (Turn ON measuring probe power & confirm) command is sent.
This may indicate a malfunction of the measuring probe. Check probe and related circuit.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: ILLEGAL SPINDLE LOAD SETTING VALUE. CHECK S-CODE ARGUMENT OF M238.
The spindle load level set by the S-Code is not within the range of 0 to 999 when the M238 (SL mode ON) command is specified.
Specify a load level with the proper range.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: M927(FIRST USE TOOL CHECK) CUSTOM MACRO VARIABLE WRITE ERROR.
An error occurred when writing to the macro variable for the M927 (first use check) command.
Writing in the macro data is not complete.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:3px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: SPINDLE LOAD EXCEEDED SPECIFIED LIMIT VALUE.
The spindle load limit value set for the SL mode was exceeded.
Check for an abnormal workpiece shape, deviation of the workpiece position, tool problem or incorrect offset value setting.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: M919 TOOL LIFE COUNTER COUNT-UP COMMAND ALARM. CHECK SPINDLE TOOL AND S-CODE VALUE.
An error occurred during writing to the tool database by the M919 (increment tool life machining quantity counter) command.
Check to see that the spindle tool number is correctly set and for a mistake in the S-Code specified in the same block as the M919 command.
There is a possibility that the tool data has failed in the update of the current value. Update data manually.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: An error occurred during writing to the tool database by the M34 (automatic workpiece measurement spare tool call) command.
Check to see that the spindle tool number is correctly set.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: FRONT DOOR DOES NOT CLOSE IN SPECIFIED TIME(10SEC).
Front door did not close within the time. (10sec)
Auto single door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=ON; LS2312=OFF;
Auto double door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=OFF; LS912=ON;
Front auto door: LS2312L=OFF; LS2312R=OFF; LS966=ON; SL1002=ON; SL1001=OFF; or Front manual door: LS966=ON;
Check limit switches, solenoid valve and mechanism.

para.text: FRONT DOOR DOES NOT OPEN IN SPECIFIED TIME(10SEC).
Front door did not open within the time.(10sec)
Auto single door: SL1001=ON; SL1002=OFF; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=ON;
Auto double door: SL1001=ON; SL1002=OFF; LS2311=ON; LS2312=ON; LS912=OFF;
Front auto door: LS2312L=ON; LS2312R=ON; LS966=OFF; SL1002=OFF; SL1001=ON;

When light curtain is not interrupted LS2315 signal must be '1'.
Remove an obstacle. Check safety light curtain.

Limit switches at both ends of front door are ON (The close end and the open end were turned ON at the same time.)
Auto single door: SL1001=ON; SL1002=OFF; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=ON;
Auto double door: SL1001=ON; SL1002=OFF; LS2311=ON; LS2312=ON; LS912=OFF;

Paper band unit healthy then LS190 must be '1'.

para.text: SERVO PC INERTIA EST. OUT OF RANGE ERROR.
During Servo PC teaching operation Estimated Inertia was out of range.
Check if the load on pallet exceeds the recommended maximum load or else report to MAKINO.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: SERVO PC INERTIA EST. OUT OF RANGE ERROR.
During Servo PC teaching operation Estimated Inertia was out of range.
Check if the load on pallet exceeds the recommended maximum load or else report to MAKINO.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Tried fixture clamp/unclamp operation, when machine is busy (machining or cycle running state).
Try fixture clamp/unclamp after machining complete or by stopping machine.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: PART SEAT SENSOR DID NOT TURN ON, CHECK FOR COMPONENT SEATING.
Seat check did not turn ON.
Number of seat check signals varies for each machine depending on fixture configuration and OEM option. Related seat check signals are LS1781 to LS1792.
Clean workpiece rest pad and check seat check signal.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: PART SEAT SENSOR DID NOT TURN OFF, SINCE LAST TIME. CHECK FOR BLOCKAGES.
Possibility is machined part was not unloaded and tried to cycle start again. This is to prevent refashioning.
Though machined part was unloaded the seat check sensor did not turn OFF. Check whether seat check is blocked.
Number of seat check signals varies for each machine depending on fixture configuration and OEM option. Related seat check signals are LS1781 to LS1792.
After machining complete unload the machined part and check seat sensor is OFF.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: FIXTURE STACK 1 CLAMP/UNCLAMP OPERATION TIMEOUT [SL2601/SL2602 PS2601/PS2602]

para.text: Fixture stack 1 clamps / unclamp operation timeout.

para.text: Check for any leakage. Also confirm solenoid and pressure switch status.

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: OPERATOR DOOR NOT CLOSED OR LIGHT CURTAIN IS OFF.FIXTURE OPERATION INHIBIT
Auto single door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=ON; LS2312=OFF;
Auto double door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=OFF; LS912=ON;
Front auto door: LS2312L=OFF; LS2312R=OFF; LS966=ON; SL1002=ON; SL1001=OFF; or Front manual door: LS966=ON;

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE CLAMP/UNCLAMP PRESSURE SWITCH ALARM.BOTH THE SWITCHES ARE ON.(PS2601/PS2602) OR (PS2603/PS2604) OR (PS2605/PS2606) OR (PS2607/PS2608)
Fixture pressure clamp side and unclamp side both switches are ON simultaneously. This may indicate pressure switch faulty.
Related pressure switches (PS2601/PS2602) or (PS2603/PS2604) or (PS2605/PS2606) or (PS2607/PS2608).
Example: Stack 1 pressure switches PS2601 and PS2602 should not switch ON at the same time.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE CLAMP SIGNAL MISSING OR FIXTURE UNCLAMPED DURING AUTO CYCLE AND SPINDLE RUNNING.
Actual fixture stack configuration varies between machines. Related solenoid (SL2601 to SL2608); pressure switch (PS2601 to PS2608).
Check for leakage; accumulator functioning; solenoid functioning and pressure switch setting range.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE POWER PACK MOTOR THERMAL RELAY HAS TRIPPED.(TH260=1).
When power pack is not overloaded TH260 must be '0'.
Confirm reason for overload, rectify and reset the alarm.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE POWER PACK OIL LEVEL IS LOW(LS2603).
Fixture power pack oil level is low.
When power pack oil level is not low level then LS2603 must be '0'.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE POWER PACK OIL TEMPERATURE IS HIGH(LS2604).
Fixture power pack oil temperature is high.
When power pack oil temperature is OK then LS2604 must be '1'.
Check oil temperature and check LS260.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE POWER PACK SYSTEM PRESSURE FAIL. CHECK FOR LEAKAGES.
Fixture power pack is ON for more than 15sec.
Fixture power pack motor MS260 is ON for more then 15sec, then this alarm happen. This is to protect the intermittent duty pump.
This may indicate leakages. Check whether pressure is building. Rectify the fault.

para.style: text-align:justify; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-before:always; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE NOT CLAMPED. CYCLE START INHIBIT.
Fixture not clamped or work seat not OK during cycle start.
Fixture clamp status lamp LHY1CL must light up. For fixture seating status, to check the lamp on the seat check sensor.
Confirm fixture clamp before cycle start.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: ROTARY AXIS(A/B) NOT AT HOME POSITION. FIXTURE CANNOT UNCLAMP.
Rotary table A/B not at home position.
AB table home position signal status.
Before fixture unclamp operation confirm AB table is at home position.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: FIXTURE OPERATION INTERRUPTED AS OPERATOR DOOR WAS OPENED OR SAFETY LIGHT CURTAIN IS OFF.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Door opened or safety light curtain interrupted. So fixture operation interrupted.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Standard machine front door close status:

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Auto single door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=ON; LS2312=OFF;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Auto double door: SL1001=OFF; SL1002=ON; LS2311=OFF; LS2312=OFF; LS912=ON;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: APC machine operator door + front door must be close status:

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Front auto door: LS2312L=OFF; LS2312R=OFF; LS966=ON; SL1002=ON; SL1001=OFF; or Front manual door: LS966=ON;

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:48px left,96px left,144px left,192px left,240px left,288px left,336px left,384px left,432px left,480px left,528px left,576px left ;
para.text: Light curtain when not interrupted LS2315 must be '1'.

para.style: text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: MACHINE NOT IN MEMORY MODE. WORK SETUP INHIBIT.
Cycle start attempted with mode switch not in memory mode.
Select memory mode before cycle start in auto.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: CYCLE RUNNING IN PROGRESS OR ALARM CONDITION. WORK SETUP INHIBIT.
Cycle running or machine in alarm condition. Auto cycle start inhibited.
If cycle is running wait until cycle is complete. If alarm condition press ALARM reset and NC reset before auto cycle start.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: FIXTURE POWERPACK SWITCHES ON/OFF FREQUENTLY > 5TIMES/MIN.CHECK FOR LEAKAGE.
Fixture power pack motor MS260 turn ON more then 5 times in 1 minute.
Actual fixture stack configuration varies between machines. Related solenoid (SL2601 to SL2608); pressure switch (PS2601 to PS2608).

This may indicate leakage which lead to pressure drop and subsequent ON/OFF of pump frequently. Check accumulator functioning. Also check system pressure and pressure switch setting as per fixture requirements.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

Pallet 2 on stocker side then SL101A=0; SL101B=1; LS102=0; LS103=1;

para.text: TOOL CLAMP CONDITIONS NOT SATISFIED CLAMP/UNCLAMP TOOL MANUALLY BEFORE TOOL CHANGE
Last tool clamping process was not confirmed.
unclamp the tool in spindle and clamp the tool manually.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: The number of count to check auto grease shots was limit value. This means it is time to change new greasing cartridge.
Replace the new greasing cartridge and reset the greasing count to 0 in Makino custom greasing screen.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

para.text: Auto Grease cartridge level is low.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: SPINDLE MOTION HAS BEEN CANCELED BY MACHINE STOP.
Spindle command is cancelled. The machine is stopped by some machine error.
Check for any machine alarm and rectify.

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Bag filter is clogged. Signal [FLC] is ON (1).
Correct the error condition and check signal [FLC] must be OFF (0).

para.style: text-align:center; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;

text-align:left; text-indent:0px; margin-top:0px; margin-right:0px; margin-bottom:0px; margin-left:0px; line-height:1.00; background-color:transparent; white-space:normal; page-break-inside:auto; page-break-after:auto; border:none; tabstops:none;
para.text: Return pump is abnormal status. Signal [MR3] is ON (1).
Correct the error condition and check signal [MR3] must be OFF (0).
